### EFF Teams Up With AV Comparatives to Test Android Stalkerware Detection by Major Antivirus Apps


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


The Electronic Frontier Foundation (EFF) collaborated with AV-Comparatives to assess the effectiveness of popular antivirus applications in detecting stalkerware on Android devices. Stalkerware refers to software used for tracking and spying on individuals without their consent, posing significant privacy threats. The study tested major antivirus apps to determine their capabilities in identifying these malicious programs. The initiative underscores the importance of reliable detection mechanisms to safeguard user privacy and highlights the ongoing challenges within cybersecurity to improve stalkerware detection and protection on mobile platforms.

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2025/11/eff-teams-av-comparatives-test-android-stalkerware-detection-major-antivirus-apps?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_4678)**

### Cloudflare Scrubs Aisuru Botnet from Top Domains List


üß† **AI ADVANCEMENT**


Cloudflare has successfully removed the Aisuru botnet from its list of top domains, marking a significant achievement in cybersecurity efforts. The Aisuru botnet, known for its malicious activities, was previously ranked in the top domains due to the high level of internet traffic it generated. Cloudflare's actions are part of its ongoing commitment to enhancing internet security and protecting users from cyber threats. By identifying and mitigating the impact of the Aisuru botnet, Cloudflare has effectively disrupted its operations,

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://krebsonsecurity.com/2025/11/cloudflare-scrubs-aisuru-botnet-from-top-domains-list/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_1317)**

### Amazon Uncovers Attacks Exploited Cisco ISE and Citrix NetScaler as Zero-Day Flaws


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


The article reports on Amazon's discovery of cyberattacks that exploited zero-day vulnerabilities in Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) and Citrix NetScaler products. These attacks took advantage of previously unidentified flaws, allowing unauthorized access and potentially compromising secure environments. Amazon's security team identified these vulnerabilities, prompting both Cisco and Citrix to issue patches to mitigate the risks. The incidents underscore the importance of timely security updates and vigilant monitoring to protect against sophisticated threats exploiting zero-day vulnerabilities. The response highlights ongoing efforts by cybersecurity

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://thehackernews.com/2025/11/amazon-uncovers-attacks-exploited-cisco.html?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_5172)**
